sentence.Network_en: I know you think I'm incurably nosey.
sentence.Network_cn: 我知道你认为我老爱管闲事，不可救药。

sentence.Network_en: But young people are incurably optimistic and women have a special knack of forgetting their troubles.
sentence.Network_cn: 可是青年人,永远朝着愉快的事情想,女人们尤其容易忘记那些不痛快.

sentence.Network_en: For herself she wanted nothing. For father and myself she was incurably ambitious.
sentence.Network_cn: 她为她自己并无所求, 可为父亲和我,却有着无法遏制的野心.

entry.tran: (疾病)无法治愈的，不可医治的
entry.def: If someone has an incurable disease, they cannot be cured of it.

example.ex: He is suffering from an incurable skin disease.
example.tran: 他患有无法根治的皮肤病。

entry.tran: 无法改变的;无可救药的
entry.def: You can use incurable to indicate that someone has a particular quality or attitude and will not change.

example.ex: Poor old William is an incurable romantic...
example.tran: 可怜的老威廉是个无可救药的浪漫主义者。

example.ex: You are either very young or an incurable optimist.
example.tran: 你要么非常年轻,要么是个不可救药的乐天派。

means.word_mean: 2. in a manner impossible to cure;

auth_sentence.content: One of its spokesmen once lamented, "People are incurably religious".
auth_sentence.res_content: One of its spokesmen once lamented, "People are incurably religious".
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One of its spokesmen once lamented, "People are incurably religious".

auth_sentence.content: Man is incurably inquisitive, and always trying to discover the origin of things.
auth_sentence.res_content: Man is incurably inquisitive, and always trying to discover the origin of things.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Man is incurably inquisitive, and always trying to discover the origin of things.
